Excellent anime for those who like a laugh. Original styles of animations incorpoate a new form of anime, storyline well structured and balanced characters provide an intruging plot that will keep you wanting more. Each character has a different form of "funny" to expand the comical horizon to all watchers. Although the settings consist of your typical Harem anime the animators slot in original settings aswell in a [successful] attempt at breaking away from your normal comedy harem.

Length: 26 eps
Original Airdates: 4/07-9/07
Demographic: Shounen
Genres: Fantasy, Romance, Comedy, Parody, Harem
Plot Synopsis
Seto no Hanayome's story revolves around a young teenage boy named Nagasumi Michishio. One day during his summer vacation, Nagasumi was saved from drowning by a mermaid, San Setouichi, in the Seto Inland Sea. However, under mermaid law, if a mermaid's identity as a mermaid has been revealed, both the mermaid who was involved and the human who saw the mermaid are to be executed. In an attempt to save both Nagasumi and San's lives, San's family, which is apparently the head of its own mob, reluctantly decides that the two are to bemarried.\n
G&#333;zabur&#333;, San's father, however, is enraged about his daughter running off and getting married, especially to a human whom he deems inferior. Between G&#333;zabur&#333;'s attempts on his life and the madcap antics of a whole slew of antagonists — including the daughter of a rival mobster and a rich male transfer student with an attraction for San — Nagasumi is not enjoying a very smooth transition into his new lifestyle.\n
(From Wikipedia)\n\n
Personal Opinion\n
Okay so I wasn't sure how this was going to turn out... I mean it's an anime about mermaids.  Well, it ended up being one of the funniest shows that i've seen thus far.\n
So.... what was unique about Seto? Well, for one... it had yakuza mermaids... therby shattering any previous notions that all mermaids are angelic. The next thing is the characters. If Gozaburo failed to get laughs, there were always his faithful flunkeys. And if that wasn't enough... ep 11 introduces us to a new character who is a direct parody of the Terminator.\n
The biggest plus is the animation style and the voice actors.  A few things that will guarantee to get laughs every time... whenever san looks dumbfounded and speaks... San's mermaid song of sleep... Runa's mermaid song of battle... and whenever Kai is exposed to sunlight.\n
In truth... it's very childish humor intended for older kids.\n
A really good series through and through...\n
I demand a second season.\n\n
8/10\n\n
Similar to...\n
- Hayate no Gotoku\n
Similar parody style humour... except Seto actually has a plot.\n\n
- Zero no Tsukaima\n
Human being dragged into an outside world of differing laws. Only thing keeping him there is love.

Are you tired of watching those "epic" and long animes? Tired of big and detailed stories? Believe me, everyone gets tired of it once in a while.
If you are, watch this. It's not possible that you won't laugh at all.
> STORY:
Even if not an important part of the anime, it's pretty interesting (but it's a very common theme among this kind of anime). 
It starts as Nagasumi Michishio is on vacation at his granny's beach house with his parents. He is swimming when a BIG wave throws him to the seafloor and (just like any other mermaid animes), he is rescued by a mermaid calledSeto San. The problem is, San's family follows the mermaid rule of having to kill any human that sees them, plus her father is a kick-ass chef of a mermaid mafia (awesome). In order not to kill Nagasumi, San decides to marry him, and they do so. After some time on the beach house (5 or 6 episodes), they go the the city as school is about to restart. The rest of the anime presents many new characters slowly.


The story isn't the main thing, but it is always happening, and you can fell it even when surrounded by nonsense jokes, and it IS a romantic anime, but not a deep one. Unfortunately, as the anime goes on, jokes go over the top and make your head go fuzzy about the story.



> ART:

Squared eyes and colourful hairstyles make the characters rather unique and fun, being extremely fitting for the so-happy anime, plus there are very detailed backgrounds at all times, and combined, they make this anime's visuals work just right. Something fancy and noticable at any episode is someone showing a scary (but funny as hell) angry face, normally San's father, and as a reaction, a scary (and one of a kind) perplexed face from Nagasumi. I just can't keep a straight face at those.

It's nothing amazingly beautiful, though.



> SOUND:

Nice soundtrack and perfect voice acting. The voice actors were made for the characters, and make you laught even more when changing their original voices to something absolutely unexpected (for example, when San sings the la-le-loo song).



> CHARACTERS:

They are ALL hilarious, with no exceptions.

Their personalities lack a bit, but man, with the jokes I just can't rate this badly. Actually, the jokes make up for every fail aspect of this anime, and that's why it gets a 10 from me.



> ENJOYMENT:

No anime can make me laugh as hard as I have while watching Seto no Hanayome, and I believe you will fell the same. It's just too funny.

The story is also fancy.



> OVERALL:

FUNNY AS HELL.

If you get tired of watching, stop and continue the other day, since the story is taken by jokes in the second half of the anime, but don't stop, you WON'T find anything like this. 



Hope you enjoy it, and make sure you don't pee on you pants! ^^

I'm little disappointed with this anime one of them is the ending. Maybe I will some explain this anime and review it. This anime if not wrong is the anode year 2007. Although this anime classic, I will not judge this anime. Precisely, this anime is very good to watch the view of the genre is already interesting that is Rom-Com or called Romantic Comedy.
“My Bride is a Mermaid,” tell about a boy named Michisio Nagasumi (Takahiro Mizushima) who was visiting his grandmother who lived in Seto’s hinterland with her family. One afternoon when Nagasumi swam in the sea, he suddenly fell asleep because hewas too frightened. At the same time, suddenly he is helped by a very beautiful mermaid named Seto Sun (Haruko Momoi) or commonly called San. In the afternoon, San visits Nagasumi’s grandmother’s house and says that Nagasumi should be responsible for the incident this afternoon.


Nagasumi and his parents were invited to the Seto Clan’s residence at the bottom of Seto Bay. Nagasumi is informed that in the mermaid rule, every mermaid whose identity has been exposed by humans must both be executed. San’s father (Kenta Miyake) who is a leader of the Seto Clan did not want it to happen to his beloved son. He originally wanted to kill nagasumi but was blocked by his mother. His mother is Seto Ren (Makiko Nabei) who suggested a solution to the problem that is married. Nagasumi initially refused because he was the feeling people should not be forced especially if not yet know each other. But after seeing the spirit of San, he also received an offer from her mother.


“My Bride is a Mermaid” is an anime you should watch because every episode will make you laugh like anime Nichijou, Baka & Test, or The Devil is a Part-Time!. This anime will make you laugh out loud. The art problem does not have to be asked because maybe some of you will think the picture is bad, ugly, and make sore eyes. In my opinion, the picture is very good considering this anime is a classic anime of 2007. Like any other school genre anime, this anime is a daily life Nagasumi and his friends and San.


As I said earlier, from the beginning I can already guess the ending. But, I will never underestimate what happened to him because of Epic Fight. Gonzo is the studio that works on this anime besides Welcome to the NHK, Rosario + Vampire, Hellsing, and others.

Seto no Hayanome is one of the most funniest I have watch till date. This anime made me laugh a lot, with their nonsense comedy. While watching this anime you will not know whats going to happen next, is quite unpredictable.
The story is about a weird couple, between a human and a mermaid, who is also daughter of a Yakuza (japanese mafia), and the anime tells us their story, the story about their relantionship. I don't want to say too much because I don't want to spoil it, but I will say that Seto no Hayanome has to be in your must watch list, it'struly worth to watch. \n
I personally like it a lot, and it's one of my favourite animes of the genre of comedy.

Seto no Hanayome can be described as a random slapstick comedy. At points none of it make any sense at all. If you are looking for comedy with a plot this is NOT your cup of tea. But if you just want mindless laughs this one can be pretty fun.
First to the bad points:
There is no plot...none. They make up a setting for Nagasumi to meet and engage San. Nagasumi, to save the woman who had just saved his live, accepts to marry her....that's all the plot you are going to get. After that is just one crazy situation after the other just to testtheir resolve to stay together. 99% of those situations make no sense at all.


There are a couple of annoying characters that I could go without. The (little) assassin Maki is the most annoying character on the anime. It's just the same jokes over and over, the same reactions. Always trying to break the couple apart. (Honestly why the hell San-chan is even friends with someone who tries to kill her fiancé every freaking episode, WTF???). At least they toned her down a bit on the last few episodes.


As a lot of slapstick comedies do, they resort to introducing new characters everytime they fill the same jokes are getting old. I find this a fault and it shows a lack of creativity. They could just create new situations, make the character evolve...but why bother? Just throw in some weird looking new guy or a new hot Tsundere and that's that...(I think this is just lazy comedy).


One last thing, I know is something pointless to wish for in this sort of anime, but I really would like to watch their relationship really grow, they becoming more like of a real couple...even if it was just a kiss.


 The good points:


The lead man, Nagasumi-kun, is subject to a lot of pain and misunderstandings while trying to win the heart of his lady. However, to be fair, if any character had a personality growth in this anime it was Nagasumi. He starts as the guy that gets punched, shoot at, slaped, etc., etc. (as always on this kind of comedy). But throughout the anime he goes from the butt of almost every single joke to a guy that really charm his way into the girls hearts. He says that he wants to be someone who San-chan can love, and you actually see him, little by little, becoming more self assured and confident (Although remember this is a comedy so he still is the butt of a lot of jokes).


As far as the female lead goes San is a more interesting leading female than a lot of other on this type of anime. She actually shows her feelings for her guy, she fights for him, all of these made her earn a LOT of points with me. Overall she is a strong female, who DOES show her love. Plus, at points she was really funny, which is refreshing since most of anime girls just blush and behave like 5 year olds.


Note: Mikawa Kai and Saru, two of the supporting characters, are freaking hilarious.


Overall this anime was fine, It guaranteed some really good laughs. If you are bored and just want to laugh, give it a try.

Seto no Hanayome is a story about Nagasumi who was forced to marry Seto San after discovering that she was a mermaid. According to the mermaid law, if any human saw a mermaid in their 'mermaid form',  the mermaid has to be killed or they have to get married. even by reading you know that it's comedy, it's hardcore comedy to the core ==. 
Story:8/10
                 For its genre, i'd say Seto no hanayomeis one of the best. The story isn't complex and most of the episodes are just for comedic purpose so few were involved in the actual plot. all this doesn't matter because the comedy will leave you laughing and wanting for more.


                 even though it's hardcore comedy, we still get to see the growth of the relationships between the characters. Most of the female characters shows interest in Nagasumi but not to the extent where i would call this a romance anime. The only real romance only goes around between San and Nagasumi. 


                  I liked how in Seto no Hanayome how episode 12/13 is a major part of the story. It makes you feel like this anime is seperated to two parts because after this they introduce a new character(Shiranui) plays an important role towards the story and ending.


                    episode 12/13 will end with San saving Nagasumi and in the end(episode 25/26), Nagasumi returns the favour by saving San from a perverted fish. these parts of the anime is just awesome, especially the ending. When you read the manga, you'll see that the anime ending doesn't really happen but the ending really feels like a movie, awesome music + action and there's still comedy even  in the serious moments of battle.


Art: 8/10

                    The art is very sharp and cute, gives you the impression of a comedy anime


Sound: 9/10

                     the op was funny to begin with. Jokes were made funnier with the sound effects.


Characters:

                      Nagasumi isn't that special. He's the type of protagonist is forced to accept everything and life. Nagasumi doesn't make most of the comedy, he's more of a medium to channel the comedy. however, you'll get to see him rock in the end.


                      San's the cute heroine of the story, from appearance to her voice, everything about San is perfect.She resembles the type of good wife any guy would want.     


                        most of the supporting characters are just damn funny specifically - Edomae, Hideyoshi and the fish trio. you have to watch for yourselves to experience the comedy.


Overall: 10/10.

                       Being a purely comedy anime, I think Seto no Hanayome is the best from all the animes i have watched. every episode was funny and the ending was satisfying. I just can't ask for more.



Anime Vs. manga:

                       The disappointing part is the manga. When I found out Seto no hanayome's manga is still ongoing, I almost jumped in excitement. First page, and I already lost interest, the art is just too simple. that's not the only bad part, all the new characters in the manga which are not shown in the anime are female and........ lesbians. They seem to show interest only towards San and will do anything to get close to her like a yandere character would. Because of all this, i stick with the anime and stopped reading the manga.

Have fun watching! :)

If you are a romance and comedy lover, this is the anime for you. It's the best romantic comedy I have seen after Ouran High School Host Club (in my opinion). Here is why you should watch this anime:
1. The English voice actors are simply brilliant, especially the main character Nagasumi's. It's the same guy who voices Watanuki in xxxHOLIC and I love his voice. (I love Watanuki, too.)
2. The characters are full of energy until the end, so it's never boring. Especially Nagasumi - something always happens to him. There is good character development at least for the two main characters. Others just hangaround.


3. The dialog was good, new, and fresh. Not your everyday dirty words (but you can learn all the new ones).


4. The story was great, the start of the story is different and fresh makes you curious to watch more (just like Ouran Host Club).


5. The situation - the problems the characters face are very unique to the story so it's not all BLA BLA BLA like in other romantic comedies. The plot is actually interesting to watch (thank God). I enjoyed it a 100%, it became one of the best comedies ever in my list (along with Ouran).

Thanks to a recommendation from my friend, I marathoned what I believe to be the funniest comedy-anime I've seen! 
For fans of Funimation or simply those looking for a good laugh, I would highly recommend this anime. 26 episodes, and I am already hoping for a second season! The summary says it all: Teen boy gets unexpectedly engaged to a cute mermaid and it's all humor and hijinks from there!
Where do I begin? For the most part, I can only say that you have to see the anime for yourself to sort of see why it's so hilarious, because if I tried to explain allthese scenarios and misconceptions and misunderstandings and awkward encounters...well, you get the idea. As for everything else, I became really attached to these characters and the way the story flowed. (Almost with scenarios like that of which you'd see on a sitcom) One of my favorite things about this anime is the two main characters, the main relationship: Nagasumi and Sun. I almost feel so sorry for Nagasumi, this character never catches a break. Every episode, it's either someone's pointing a weapon at him, or he's become the center of a huge misunderstanding or he has a near-death experience, and it's really all for nothing, because this character is not bad in any way, he has no evil or dark intentions, he's really just trying to make his future wife feel at home and happy on land, and no one really sees that. And Sun, she's a fun character to see in action, she has a really deep-spirited attitude towards her home of the seas, but on land, she's kind of an airhead, considering the ways of the humans that she's not entirely used too. By the end of the show, it's quite surprising how much development these two go through for just a comedy! The supporting characters for the most part, are a ton of fun, these are really likable characters, especially in the school setting that appears in this anime. \n\n
If I had to pick a leading factor in this anime's humor, it's the animation. To be more specific, the faces. Any time something goes wrong, or there's a huge misunderstanding right down to a sex-innuendo, the faces and reactions of these characters are downright hysterically laugh-till-you-can't-breathe-FUNNY! And since it's an anime, it pays off even more! It might be just that I have that wacky sense of humor, but from most of the reviews I've read, people share the same thoughts as I do with this show's humor and I don't blame them. Like everyone else, I strongly feel there's much more this anime can explore and show, and while it is very unlikely, I would love to see a second season, but to be honest, I'm perfectly fine too with the way this anime ended at episode 26. It leaves you with a couple questions but also lets you fill the voids for yourself. Overall, I really enjoyed this anime, defiantly recommend it to people into the humor-genre of anime. \n

The plot's simple and not that important. The events in each episode are maybe a little cliche but they're so well bended to fit the characters of this anime.
The dialogue is hilarious and sometimes really absurd because of the diversity in characters: there's a monkey, a shark, a giant squid, even the terminator, ... I didn't like all characters as much but most of them are a great addition to the cast.
The animation is good as well, switching style and background at just the right moment. One minor remark is the blood which is strangely rainbow colored. It makes it more noticeable but I hadto think twice before I realized it was blood.\n\n
I wanted to watch this for a while now but I decided to watch it with a friend and it was worth sharing the experience. Almost each episode was pure gold.

I started this anime because it happened to catch my attention, and let me just start by saying:
Watching this anime was an AMAZING decision.
I know I can't speak for everyone who has seen this anime, but if you had to put your faith in me, I'd recommend this anime without a second thought.
It has many "OMG" funny moments that'll have you laughing out loud. Coupled with numerous surprise jokes, an interesting plot, hilarious running gags, and an interesting cast of characters, this show has potential to win almost any comedy show viewer. 
To top it off, unlike other 12 to 26 episode animes with blandfinales (or lack of finales altogether), this anime has an amazing finale that truly tied the show together for a more-than-satisfying finale (especially for a show of this genre). In my humble opinion, the finale took an already 9/10 show and turned it into a 10/10.\n\n
This is my first review on this site, but in order to give you a little background info about me: I've seen quite a few comedy-oriented anime on top of all the other animes that are generally seen. I've been watching anime since I was 4 or 5, so I can safely say I've seen A LOT. \n\n
Keeping that in mind, there's no doubt in my mind that My Bride is a Mermaid was one of the greatest, most funniest anime I have ever seen. I found it to be really similar to my other all time favorite comedy anime Baka and Test. So if you loved shows like Baka and Test, Ouran High School Host Club, Angel Beats, World God Only Knows, The Devil is a Part-Timer, etc then you'll definitely love My Bride is a Mermaid.\n\n
Happy viewing! ^_^

There are anime that make you laugh and there are ones that will make you giggle, but in the end they lose their touch thus the anime that is suppose to be funny turns out to be something that is not. Those anime make up a large portion of the comedy anime that are available out in the world, which leaves only a small percentage that is consider real comedy. Seto no Hanayome is one of those anime, part of the 1% population, that will make you laugh and continue to laugh for quite a few more minutes. 
The plot is simple, straight-forward thus itis easy to understand, but do not let that fool you. The plot may be simple, but is decorated with many comical moments that pose more benefits than harm. In a sense, the comedy is truly something to laugh about because the jokes and references are meaningful thus there is always something that back up the joke. I might not be an expert when it comes to making joke, but if you make a joke out of the blue and it has no connection to the context whatsoever then it might not turn out to be a joke the audience would laugh at. Seto no Hanayome  does that in a way that it is hilarious and flows with the story which as I mentioned earlier is straight-forward thus giving the anime an edge. The simple plot makes it easy to insert comical scenes here and there, so the plot works with the anime rather than against it.


The art I must add, is not the best nor is it the worst I have seen. It is average in terms of graphic; the fight scenes are decent. The looks of the characters overall are not that bad, but it is definitely an improvement from the art in the manga. On the other hand, when it comes to OP and ED the anime have captivating and heart warming songs which match the anime comical atmosphere. 


The entertainment of the anime is amazing that someone should "raise the roof" literally.The simple story-line combined with many good comedy the anime will keep you on the edge of your edge and there won't be one second for you not to laugh. There no cliffhangers, no suspense, no captivating things that will make you come back for more, but what the anime does have is comedy. The comedy make us want more because, who doesn't want to laugh? The anime takes something as simple as comedy and make it larger thus taking full advantage of it which is fairly noticeable in other anime.


 It is splendid anime and is geared toward anime fan who enjoy comedy, plain and simple.

Seto no Hanayome is by far one of the best rom-coms I have ever seen. Although my horizons in the rom-com genre are quite narrow, the previous statement is still saying alot. As a person who loves to laugh but rarely does due to lack of comedic material, I found SnH quite amusing. This is an anime that took the harem and rom-com genre and made It into something original and genuinely funny. 
Plot
Unfortunately, the plot was the one aspect of this series that was generic. It was a forced marriage conflict and how the people react and develop from it. Every episode, save thelast one, had little to no drama or impact but they were amusing nonetheless. This series lacks a deep plot, but I never expected one anyway. However, I was quite satisfied with the ending. The ending wrapped up everything into a neat package, which most harem/rom-com animes do not. 


Characters

The characters were by far the most enjoyable part of the series. There were some character archtypes such as the tsundere, but most of the cast was very well-developed and  unique. The two main characters, San and Nagasumi, had some very interesting chemistry. Their relationship was very predictable at first, but it turned into something that I could appreciate.


Art

I have to mention that this series uses ALOT of exaggerated expressions and random "chivalry" scenes. You'll know what I mean by the first episode. Art-wise, this series delivers relatively well. The drawings were very clean and detailed and the animation had no flaws as far as I could see.


Soundtrack

The opening was catchy and pleasant at first, but then it got irritating after the 10th playthrough. Same with the ending theme. The BGM was rather nice, but then I realized they only used like 8 songs throughout the whole series. It got a bit redundant but the hilarious scenes deviated my attention slightly.


Overall/Who Should Watch it

SnH is a true gem in the rom-com genre. It actually makes you laugh while retaining a good romantic plot and whatnot. Don't get me wrong, it's not groundbreaking nor is it a comedic masterpiece, but it was damn funny at the least. Anyone with a decent sense of humor can appreciate this show. Go check it out for a couple dozen laughs.

Seto no Hanayome- This review came kinda late, but I'm writing this for one of my most favorite anime of all time. At first I wasn't a big fan of romance/comedy type anime, but after watching this, It made me into one. This is possibly the best romance/comedy anime I ever watched.
Seto no Hanayome seems like your normal romance/comedy anime, but this anime was very hilarious. Yup, Hilarious to the EXTREME. Now moving on to my review.......
Story- Story is about a boy named Michishio Nagasumi who is saved by a mermaid(whoa! Pretty Rare), who was actually drowning in the middle of the sea...How did heeven get there? Even I don't know. Well~ I will just explain until there..You can get more info in this website anyways. Now, the story is great at start but when it progresses, it starts going nowhere. Many episodes were pretty random but very hilarious. The ending? It was awesome. Story sometimes a bit dull but you'll pretty soon ignore the story once you like the hilariousness. Story= 8 out of 10.


Art- Animation was great BUT didn't always stay that way. There were few "graphical anomalies". Sometimes, characters look different than usual. They sometimes look kind of funny and weird. That's a flaw which I find, quite annoying. But graphics still are mostly great. Art= 7 out of 10.


Sound- Sound? OP and ED are both very awesome. I loved both of OP and ED and its extremely catchy. Especially, the 2nd ED, which is VERY cute. Voice-acting was absolutely great. No, I'm not being sarcastic. Its true. Sound= 9 out of 10.


Character- Many characters have very wacky attitudes and always acted so strangely which makes it extremely hilarious. Character designs are great~ . Character= 10 out of 10.


Enjoyment- All the enjoyment comes from the wackiness and how hilarious this anime is. This anime is probably the most funniest anime I ever watched, and personally, even funnier than School Rumble. Hilariousness remains over-the-top in each single episode and maybe each single minute. Many episodes were pretty pointless which is why the anime doesn't focus on its story much. The anime isn't even serious most of the time. But still its very funny. The jokes doesn't get old too. Is is re watchable? Yes and  Very high indeed. Enjoyment= 10 out of 10.


Overall- Seto no hanayome is recommended for everyone to watch. Whether you hate romance type anime, this anime could make you into a fan of romance! 

But if you want more serious romance, go watch any of the EF series. Now if you'll excuse me, I need to go watch Seto no Hanayome again...for the 22nd time.

OVERALL= 10 out of 10...actually it should be a 1000 out of 10.

As there is a few reviews i will do an early review of what i think about what i have seen in the first 9 episodes.
The story is quite strange with it about a girl who's a mermaid but with a story like that i would expect ecchi which there is NONE in this anime was is good for most people. Never have I laughed so hard at such simple jokes and parodies! They execute these in such a manner that it feels almost natural! Even the individual characters themselves are commonplace in most animes, but in my opinion, they are used well and properly! Their not just random characters slapped into the story for one episode, almost every character you see you will see at least three more times! The OVA's ,however, introduce a new character, but with lack of support of who she is, which leaves a opening for this character to show up in the nonexistent next season.
The anime begins with a unluckyguy named Nagasumi Michishio, who one day while at the beach, he is drowning for some apparent reason (there is no explanation to why he got into that situation) and is saved by a mermaid. Later, after waking up on the beach, he goes back to his grandma's house and tells his parents, who in return think he was seeing things, but later that night, a group of Yakuza looking men show up with the mermaid girl between them. He is shocked when they take him, his mother, and father to the sea, thinking they will dump them in the sea, but instead they jump with them, and bring them to an underwater dojo of some sort. He finds out that the name of the mermaid girl that saved him is Sun Seto, who is the daughter of the mermaid Seto Yakuza Family. Under mermaid law the person who saw, or the mermaid who revealed themselves, must be executed, but instead they are to be married. The father however, dislikes this whole plan, and continuing through the series, he attempts to  assassinate, eliminate, kill, terminate, murder, or mutilate Nagsumi in anyway possible


As the story progresses he gains abilities such as the ability to avoid anything thrown at him, and with the help of Sun, take down crazy fanboys,  henchmen, and other people who disturb his not so normal lifestyle. Another character comes to rival Sun, the daughter of their rival family, Lunar Edomae, who is a pop idol in Japan, she joins the series somewhere between the 6 or 7, 7 being a war over most popular girl in the school Sun Vs. Lunar!


My final comment on this anime is that the story is set, the art is awesome, the sound is always good, the characters are likable or dis-likable in a good way. My overall rating would be a 9.5/10

When I first saw this anime as I was searching through the anime section on Hulu, I sort of just scrolled by thinking about what an anime about Mermaid's could be like. I kept thinking, but I just kept scrolling and found other animes that interested me. So I had kind of forgot about ever thinking about watching this anime. Then, one day, as I'm watching an episode of an anime under the "Recommended for You" was "My Bride is a Mermaid."  Well now that I couldn't get this thing out of my head, I just decided to give it a try. And Iam so glad I did give it a try.


My Bride is a Mermaid is one of the funniest and most original animes I've ever watched and I couldn't stop watching it! Since the first episode I had been hooked on it. It sounds like a simple romance anime about a boy who meets a girl and his world is changed forever, but it is nothing like that. One day, Nagasumi Michishio is out in the middle of the ocean, drowning, and no one can hear him...except the Seto meramid Sun Seto who saves Nagasumi from drowning.  


I could give a summary all about this anime but you guys should just watch it and see how awesome and wonderfully funny this anime really is. The artwork style is adorable, and the theme song ties the whole anime together. It's really worth watching :D

First of all, when I grade an anime I usually don't base my score on art and sound because I don't think I've got enough experience or knowledge to assess an anime for that aspects. Sometimes they can affect my grade if they're extraordinary but most of the time I give a grade based on my enjoyment through characters, development and story as it happened for this show.
Parody is not a genre I like very much and watch often that's why the somehat low grade. In all fairness it is one of the better parody anime I've ever watched so you should give it atry if you like this genre and most probably you wouldn't be disappointed.


The story is about a kid who had to marry a mermaid from a mafia clan. Mermaid comes to his home and lives with him and goes to the same school. Since they can't tell anyone that they are supposed to be married and because it is a harem anime, girls in the show one by one falls in love with him as well.


As I said before I don't like parody genre and there were couple of times when I almost dropped this anime however due to its good rating I tried to finish it and I'm glad that I did because I don't know if I get used to the comedy of the show or if it was the plot but after 20th episode it really picked up. Especially 20th episode is one of the funniest anime episodes I've ever watched. 


There is almost no character development but it is a comedy show and all of the characters' roles are pretty set at the start and it works. One thing I don't like is how they got to the ending. It feels really rushed. At the last 2 episodes all of a sudden lead character changes and that change start the ending story.


One last thing. I'm gonna try to be as vague as I can be to not give away spoilers but if you like to know how they conclude the harem aspect of an anime, like me, then this might interest you. When this show is finished nothing had set in stone but I think it is one of better one on that aspect.

Some anime's you watch and you know what to expect and they either live up to expectations or they disappoint, Seto no Hanayome on the other hand falls into the category of what the.....
I honestly can not describe what Seto no Hanayome actually is but is one of the funniest parody anime's out there. Although most of the parodying goes straight over my head it still manages to make me laugh.
The story is basically about a middle high school boy called Nagasumi on holiday with his parents in Seto Island gets into trouble while swimming in the sea and begins to drown. However, he issaved my a mermaid called Seto san. Normally this would be a good thing but Seto San is the daughter of the head of Seto Island Yakuza and now he knows that mermaids exist he a) must be killed b) Seto San must be killed or c) Seto San and Nagasumi must marry. Obviously he chooses option c).


Negasumi assumes this is a marriage of convenience but Seto San takes it very seriously and moves in and goes to school with Nagasumi on the condition that the fact she is a mermaid is kept a secret. Unfortunately for Nagasumi this is when his problems begin.


Now this where you would expect Seto no Hanayome to go down the usual romantic comedy route where Seto San is constantly splashed by water and Nagasumi desperately tries to cover it up with hilarious results. Which it does and then some.


Seto San's father becomes their homeroom teacher and wants to beat Nagasumi to a pulp, Seto San's mum is the school nurse and Seto San is joined by Maki a shellfish assassin whose goal it is to kill Nagasumi while looking innocent in front of Seto San.


It gets worse for Nagasumi. His favourite pop idol moves in his house where it turns out she is the daughter of the head of the rival yakuza clan to the Seto clan, her cute public personality masks an evil side and treats Nagasumi as a servent, a member of the Seto Clan is really a shark who wants to eat him and the rich son of another yakuza clan is a love rival and arrives in the most bizarre places in a submarine.


To say Nagasumi's life becomes complicated is an understatement.


The art is pretty average but the story, characters and sound more than make up for it.


Don't worry in trying to understand what is going on 100% of the time just sit back and enjoy the ride.

This review is for the original Japanese version of "Seto no Hanayome", not the english dubbed version by Funimation:
"Seto no Hanayome" is a Romantic Comedy anime that doesn't so much focus on the romance aspect to get you through the story as much as it's comedy. The anime starts you off with a rom/com feel, but it quickly digresses into comedy that overwhelms the romance aspect. There are still your typical romantic moments here and there between Nagasumi and Sun, as well as Lunar and co. I would've wished to see more romance in the series but the humor in the show was funny enoughso that I didn't mind. A good portion of the humor in this anime was parody based. For example, Lunar's father is parodied after "the Terminator" which leads to utter hilarity in the moments when he is present. One thing I loved about this anime was its Music. Most of (if not all) the vocal music in this anime is done by the seiyuus of Sun and Lunar. The songs range from funny, to catchy, to awesome in this series. My personal favorite in the series is the opening "Romantic Summer" by both Sun & Lunar. All in all, a really funny anime with some nice romantic moments in between all the chaos. Highly recommended!

I am not gonna lie the first 5 or 6 episodes i wasn't liking and was getting tempted to drop the show. I am very glad i didn't cause this has turned into one of the funniest anime iv'e seen.
It is hard to even be able to make a guess as to what the next episode will entail. This is one of the best parts it can either involve sending a Titan obsessed with his porn to the moon or it can involve ass acne. There are some jokes that get old after the first 15 times. But they do start to get better onhow to pace the jokes later on.


For me after i got past the first couple episodes this was an amazing show. The first few episodes are filled with as mentioned above use of the same joke ( Facial animation, Being attracted to a black dude with an afro) and also annoying characters. One of witch is actually a good character after a certain point in the show. But you do have to deal with the MC's parents who are awful ( Mostly the Mother) 


The main female star ( Seto ) Is in all honestly the best part for me. She makes jokes at the right time and she is also adorable all through out the season.


Would suggest to watch this if it sounds like your cup of tea.

Genre: Comedy, Romance, School
Staring  Takahiro Mizushima (Nagasumi Michishio), Haruko Momoi (San Seto), Sakura Nogawa (Lunar Edomae) 
The begining of the story is somehow unattractive. Until the part where the protagonist was save from drowning. From that onwards. It really absorbed me into the protagonist's situations throughout the anime. Imagine what will you do if some girl asked to be your wife out of the blue when you are on a school vacation with your parents around? Too good to be true huh? 
But this does bother me though. Having a mermaid as a wife. Duh what am i saying!
Alright. The story is somehow overallreasonabily entertaining and amusing. But I don't really find the ending of this anime satisfying, since it ends too brief and sudden. \n\n

This is one of my favourite animes of all time. Now, I'm not naive. This isn't a must watch show like Bebop or GitS and I know romantic comedies/harem shows aren't for everyone. But if you give it a chance you'll be more than pleasantly surprised.
The story begins with Nagasumi, a seemingly average Japanese high schooler, drowning in the ocean. He's saved by a mermaid, Sun, but unfortunately for both of them the merfolk have very strong laws against being seen by humans. Complicating the matter is that Sun is the only daughter of the leader of a Yakuza group, meaning these laws can't justbe overlooked. And what is the punishment for breaking these laws? Death, for either the human or the mermaid. Luckily there's a 3rd option that you can guess from the anime's title; marriage. If Sun and Nagasumi are married, they'll be family and the laws won't apply. And so begins their bumpy road to a relationship, as Sun's overprotective father and his Yakuza attempt at every turn to kill Nagasumi, Sun moves in with him, they struggle to adjust to both of their respective worlds and Nagasumi desperately tries to keep Sun's secret a secret from others like his odd "friend" Chimp or his police officer aspiring childhood friend Mawari.


It's a unique set up for a rather typical romcom storyline. Mermaids don't get much exposure in any kind of media these days so it feels fresh despite using a creature we're all familiar with at this point and they've got some interesting takes on mermaid culture in modern society.


Ultimately however it's never the setting that makes a romcom, it's the characters. And this show does a great job with them. Nagasumi is a fairly typical lead, a decent guy that you occasionally feel sorry for considering the stress he has to go through because of his new situation. But he's not perfect; there are times when he's a dick, or lazy, or inconsiderate. Basically he's human and, sadly, that's a breath of fresh air for this genre. If you're tired of seeing the typical white knight that stumbles into "perverted" scenarios every episode, then you'll enjoy Nagasumi.


Sun, as his opposite, is the true star. As I said above, she's a ditz, maybe even stupid at times, but she's got a heart of gold and legitimately cares about Nagasumi. It's tough not to like her. And...that's really all I need to say about her. She was my favourite character and considering she's a lead, that's great.


There's a handful of other characters, all fleshed out and feeling like actual people even if some are a little...eccentric. Sun's dad is a bonafide psychopath, but at his heart he just loves his only daughter. Chimp is, well, Chimp and Lunar, despite seeming to be mentally unstable, really just wants to be loved. There's more, but I'll leave it here since most of the fun is in discovering and experiencing these characters for yourself. 


It's at this point too that I want to say I feel this is a harem anime done right. That might be an odd thing to say, since all a harem would need to be "right" is a guy and a bunch of girls obsessed with him, but its always too unrealistic for me to suspend my disbelief. The girls are shells, filling one trope or another and existing purely to populate the harem. This isn't the case in My Bride Is A Mermaid. All of the girls, despite having and/or developing feelings for Nagasumi, are characters in their own right. They're not defined by their feelings for Nagasumi and it's an important distinction. You can imagine them existing without him, which isn't the case in other harems like, say, Rosario to Vampire. I hate to keep using this term but it's just a breath of fresh air.


The animation is good, if nothing special. It's typical of what you expect of a modern anime without standing out. The music fits, keeping the tone upbeat and generally working to keep in line with the light hearted comedic half of the show. The VAs are at the top of their game as well, with Lunar's VA sounding like she had a bunch of fun with the role.


Overall, this is a must see for romcom fans and I feel you should give it a try even if you're not into the genre. There's few, if any, better examples that you could find.

Before I start this review, I will warn you about my method of making reviews. I will be making this as if I don't know anything about Japanese ethics, culture, reasoning, and etc. Also I will take facts and information solely gathered from the anime itself. With that in mind, lets get on with the review.
Story: 9
This anime has a pretty good story that has a an interesting beginning. Our story begins with out main character, Nagasumi Michishio, drowning due to some particular reason not given within the anime. From what I gathered from the anime, a mermaid by the name of Sun Seto rescueshim. After a lot of scenes,the main character is forced to either marry Sun or die due to mermaid law. Of course the anime would be about the marriage route, since it has 24 episodes. As the story progresses, Nagasumi slowly gains new abilities and meets new people, such as his supposed "rival in love",Kai Mikawa, and Sun's rival, Lunar Edomae .Many of the episodes contain his misadventures that relate to the mermaid realm of mob and ethics or how they are affecting his life. A common trait constantly pushed through the anime is Chivalry, mostly by Sun herself.The rest is for your pleasure to watch and LOLIHO! LOLIHO! LOLI LOLI LOLIHO!


Art: 8

The art is from  the early 2000's and is quite good for its time, but there is some haziness or static during some parts of the anime that bothered my eyes, but altogether was pleasant to look at, with bright colors that were light on the eyes.


Sound: 10

Might as well have been perfect since voicing is spot on, the intro is actually worth a watch, and many of the songs within the anime are quite entertaining


Characters: 10

Bear in mind, many of the characters are not original, but are portrayed so well,  it is forgiven, from tough guys to sissies, this anime has it covered in every way, shape or form. For example, Sun's father, Gozaburo hates Nagasumi, because he does not wish to give away his daughter to anybody (not incestual) and is willing to get rid of Nagasumi through any means necessary. Nagasumi, however does not often return the sentiment and merely tries to avoid his wrath, due to his levelheaded nature and pacifistic tendencies, he often is running from whatever it is that is trying to kill him.


Enjoyment: 10

There's not one point in this anime that I didn't find myself laughing at or face palming (in a good way) and I constantly cracked more smiles in a day then I will for the rest of my life


This anime truly is worth every minute spent, but I will warn you, don't drink or eat during the majority of this anime or you will be choking on it or having it come out your nose!

Out of all the animes I have ever seen, only 2 would receive a perfect score... Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann and SETO NO HANAYOME. Both are animes about manliness and both are one of a kind animes that will most likely never be satisfactorily duplicated. I remember laughing so hard tears were coming out of the corner of my eyes during Seto no hanayome.
Story - Great story. It does not follow the story arc format like naruto or full metal alchemist. Instead every episode or every few episodes present their own conflicts. But this is what makes the show so FUNNY. One thing to bewary of is that the humor is extremely fast paced, so if you are not a speed reading champion, you will probably find yourself pausing the anime a few times so you can finish reading the subtitles. But at the same time their rapid talking speed is so hilarious you can't help but laugh.


Art - The animation is extremely high quality. You can see the glare from the sun reflect off their hair. It is very well done.


Sound - The music is great! I found myself downloading all of the intro, ending, and character songs once I had completed the anime. The music does an excellent job creating tension and excitement during all the proper moments especially during the finale.


Characters - Oh my God! I loved all the characters. None were annoying and they were all different. Nagasumi (the main character) is the funniest anime character you will ever encounter in your life. His variety of facial expressions can only be rivaled by Great Teacher Onizuka.


Finally, let me clarify how amazing this anime is. If God said he would either wipe this anime from existence or kill me, I would choose the latter.


As a final note, all of the user recommendations for animes that you might like if you liked Seto no Hanayome are all lies. The top three recomendations, Nagasarete Airantou, To Love-ru, and Hayate the Combat Butler, were three animes that I tried and dropped. I found them to either be monotonous or have an annoying type of ecchi humor.

I randomly stumbled upon this anime just to watch something.  I didn't realize just what I had stumbled upon.  I figured it was typical guy gets mixed with girl and spends the next few episodes trying to completely get wither her and there to be some sad moments.  Instead I get an anime that is rare to find, a comedy/romance harem that just blows you out of the water (no pun intended). 
Each episode seem to be even funnier then the last, I don't remember there being a dull moment and the 26 episodes there are. each time you think somethings settledand new character/twist just turns up to make you laugh up a lung.  


The harem part of this anime doesn't seem to follow most though and is focused around the main couple, give take few scenes.  As for the characters I found it hard not to love each and everyone one of them due to their uniqueness and the timely entrances and antics.


This has anime is amazing and I say this an one for the ages that everyone needs to watch and put on their list.

just a few weeks ago i became a member of MAL yet i haven't given any reviews to some animes i've watched after i became a member, but when i  watched the first five episode of seto no hanayome i've been having this urged to give this anime a review. now that im finished watching it, i want to give my first review to this anime. :)
seto no hanayome how would i describe it, at first glance seeing its cover and reading its synopsis you would think that this anime is just one of those many harem, romance, school anime  you have alreadyseen,well yes it is except that this anime is a comedy yet makes you cry..cry out laughing so hard,


so for those who are planning to watch this anime i recommend to prepare a amount of water coz ur throat will surely dry cause of laughing nonstop...

I love how the animation changes up and uses different (sometimes classic) styles. Well Seto no Hanayome is a pretty good anime but for me it kinda missing something. Too many people it will be obvious that the show copies a lot of tropes from Urusei Yatsura: forced to marry a girl from a different race, rich rival with a sword, family friends that do not like the protagonist and many others. Trouble is the main character Nagasumi is an embarrassment for a man or a boy.He is the subservient man to women around him and also the show repeats the gag with him being attracted by Masa because Masa did CPR on him a bit too much.These gay vibes from him are annoying and I doubt a woman would be attracted by a man that is so subservient and so effeminate as him. Unlike Ataru who was fun, chased skirts and fought to survive those that try to kill him Nagasumi just acts like a scaredy cat. Also the whole thing with Nagasumi mother almost cucking his father is a bit too much and I find it in poor taste. While Ataru's mother constantly shames him she is not actively trying to cuck him. Shows promoting being effeminate and a cuck are disturbing to say the least.

Two words: CHOCOLATE HANDGUN!!! That was my favorite part of the show and if you watch it, you'll understand too. this show had me laughing my ass off, and that is something that very few shows can say. Yeah they might make me laugh, but not on such a regular basis such as this.
Story: boy meets girl as boy is drowning to death, girl is a mermaid(surprise) and saves his life, girls dad has his gang kidnap boy and his family because anyone who has seen a mermaid needs to die or that mermaid him/herself, boy and girl decide to get married because somehow thatarrangement prevents their untimely demise.


Art/sound: Art was great. the sound? its sound, its there, that's all it needs to do, end of story.


Characters: none of the characters are really all that deep, but since this is comedy we should already know or have guessed that by now. The characters all have their single-minded desires and its just funny because of the complete obviousness of what they are trying to do. In fact, I credit a lot of the humor to this.


Enjoyment: I spent half of my time doubled-over laughing, of course I enjoyed it, what else am I going to say at this point?


Overall: Its one of the better animes that I have seen and I cant believe that I had never heard of this until I randomly stumbled across it like I did. To anyone who's reading this that wants to know whether you should watch it: JUST WATCH IT!

OK, First of all, this is my first review. And i'm not 100% sure what to do but bear with me. This is my favourite anime of all time so it will be hard to judge this legitimately. I have also watched twice and i am rewatching it for the third time now.
Story 10: My favourite story ever, the idea of marrying a mermaid is fantastic, not to mention the heaps of benefits that come with it. However there are also some hidrances such as school warfare and many other halarious things.
Art 8: Not the best art, but it was intsantly acceptable. Also it wasn'tforgettable either, it kinda sticks with you. 


Sound 10: Also had my favourite opening and endings of all time, the backgrounds sounds were also great. None of it is forgettable unlike some other anime.


Character 10: Great character developement, I enjoyed seeing San and Nagasumi's relationship grow, the other characters side stories were encorperated into the main storyline very well too, none of those random changes and shit. Japanese voice actors were great, english dub wasn't terrible, but i hate dubs.


Enjoyment 10: I laughed my ass off every episode, from lewd humor to just plain crazy shit, Seto No Hanayome delivers, again and again.


Overall 10: My Favourite anime, along with Angel Beats and Ichiban Ushiro no Daimaou. Make sure you watch in a good quality and be ready for laughs, tears, and your previous favourite to be knocked down.

Seto no Hanayome is a romantic comedy anime that made me smile from start to finish. Each episode utilizes the elements of its mermaid plot and use of the characters personality to execute funny moments. This show focuses more on comedy for like 90% of the time all throughout the series and only 10% on the romantic side.
Story: 6/10
There’s a plot yes, but the comedy is what made Seto no Hanayome entertaining. This show tried to develop the story by introducing and involving characters between the main protagonist and the main heroine but no interesting turn to advance the story ever happened. The mini arcfor most of the characters has good pacing and have nice outcomes, but there are noticeable plot holes that will leave you scratch your head if you pay attention. Story is pretty much the achilles heel for this show; the good thing is it is overshadowed by the comedy it gives to the audience. 


Art:  7/10

No character looks the same as the other. The animation is fun to watch as scenery doesn't just stand still. The characters also express silly facial expressions that can make you will burst out laughing. Though I can’t say the animators did an excellent job. The animation is consistent but just as good as any standard quality animation.


Sounds: 8/10

Music is the spice for the comedy of this anime. The music director did a good job selecting music for each moment as you can feel the emotion of the characters when they feel sad, rage, hyperactive and when getting serious. No memorable soundtrack but the opening theme is, as I write this review I can still hear the opening song inside my head.


Characters: 8/10

The cast are enjoyable to watch. Each has an interesting personality that contributes for the entertainment of the show. Introduction for some supporting cast will annoy you as they display their role to fullest but they will tone down as episodes gone by. Character development is unnoticeable but it did manage to use the cast well enough to catch your attention. It has a plain protagonist but not dense, airhead heroine but has a humorous personality and supporting cast that tends to be annoying from time to time but still manage to be likable.


Enjoyment: 8/10

This anime started out promising as a romcom anime. I am a bit disappointed by the fact that this show focuses more on comedy than romance. It does manage to have consistent humor because like I said it made me smile from start to finish, even at my least favorite moment. I enjoyed the misunderstanding moments and the characters interactions with one another from complements to insults.


Overall, Seto no Hanayome is a fun to watch anime series. It will disappoint you if you are hoping to watch some good romance but it will satisfy you if you are hoping to watch a show that will make you laugh. Story is not a factor, but fun characters and hilarious moments will make up for it.

Overall: mediocre school rom-com whose decent cast and occasional bursts of comedy/parody don't save it from overall drudgery.
_Seto no Hanayome_ stars the generic harem comedy male lead whose main characteristics are mysteriously attracting female attention, remarkable physical endurance, and the devil's own luck. This scenario features him being saved by a mermaid who then has to marry him to prevent him from being executed for knowing about mermaids; subsequently, he 'enjoys' the attention of her unhappy relatives & yakuza loyalists, admirers, and rivals, who all accurately enough observe that she's too good for him, but of course it turns out to be true love anyway.(A time-honored formula going back at least to _Urusei Yatsura_.)


The plot is heavy on cliche. Each character has their shtick and boy do they ever stick to it (don't expect characters like Gozaburo Seto to change through the many episodes; Shark-san will continue to try to eat the lead, the mother will swoon over Masa, etc etc).


What rescues SnH from the delete-immediately category is its willingness to take the 'secret mermaid society' conceit and run with it (the mermaids' inborn fear of cats; San's fear of her policewoman classmate Mawari; the Seto Special Squad brothers; the Seto TV shopping channel with tail-enhancing prosthetics; Nakajima constantly being an octopus without it being remarked, and octopus kebabs showing up suspiciously often), and to engage in over the top parodies (the two-episode war between San & Luna loyalists, chockful of _Fist of the North Star_ references & shonen parody; the similar OVA 1; episode 24 where Kai is dying; the Masa mini-episodes slyly mimicking the 'bar scenes' in yakuza/crime dramas, where the game is to guess which character he's talking to before the punchline; Lunar's Papa's _Terminator_ episode and then later allusions; Saru's ero-hermit; episode 19's jidaigeki setting & equation of man-mermaid pairings as a threat to the existing order akin to pro-Imperial revolutionaries in Tokugawa Japan; ep22's depiction of San's ideal delinquent boyfriend). The more 'serious' romantic arc like ep02 and ep25-26 are also good enough to not leave a bad taste.


What stops SnH from being better than the watch category is its many wasted opportunities.

For example, the tail-changing-in-water mechanic might be considered to be the prelude to constant hijinks; as we saw with _Ranma 1/2_, a water-change mechanism can be exploited in countless ways. SnH uses it a few times and forgets it. Or, the first time San does her 'chivalry is spelled the same way as mermaid' shtick, you might infer that this will be ripe for comedy as irrelevant coincidences of kanji lead a headstrong San into considerable silliness. Nope. The yakuza/Mawari angle is weirdly downplayed.

And SnH has entire misfiring episodes: episodes 12 & 13 would've been better combined; episode 14 seems a bit thin as a standalone episode (an entire episode on mermaid fear of cats?) and like it would have worked much better as a subplot in another episode; episode 15 is a complete waste, as is episode 21 (both focused on the president character, who should've been mercilessly cut); episode 20 is just uncomfortable and not nearly as funny as the creators apparently think; episode 23 tries to resolve the Masa character but just leaves him in a weird limbo state vis-a-vis his sister which makes one wonder why ep23 even existed when Masa was fine on his own as a 'cool gangster'/mentor character. 26 episodes is a lot of time to work with, but if you want a good comedy, you can't leave so much slack & worthless material. (A similar problem sabotaged _Nichijou_: too much space to fill, not enough top material.)


So you couldn't really compare it to better comedies like _FMP: Fumoffu_ or _Azumanga Daioh_ or better dramas like _Toradora_.

The story starts out predictable enough, some boy is forced to marry a girl but that's when it stops. The girl he's supposed to marry is a mermaid and he's forced to hide that fact from public and avoid the girl's fathers rage. It's really funny and i enjoyed watching it a lot but the best word that comes to mind is inconclusive. It doesn't have an ending...
I'm not saying the anime is bad, in fact it's a real funny one but it just ends there, the final episode happens and everything is the same as it was when it started, nothing major happens. Ifyou're looking for a laugh, I'd recommend this one.

An orginal when it comes to comeical animes.  Pretty clean for its comedy.  Very different from the average comedy, but maybe thats due to the plot.
     Boy meets girl, who just so happens to be a mobster's daughter, well if that wasn't enough, just slam in there that this mob consists of mermaids and the boy becomes forced into marriage, and there is the based for the comedy of the anime.  
     It brings forth a mixture of love and survival for the young boy, as he has tokeep his girlfriend/wife's mermaid sercet from the rest of the world.  The mermiad mob keeps pressure on the boy and tries to break apart the young couple, by ANY MEANS NECESSARY.\n\n
     A good one to watch when you need all types of laughter to fill the day.

If you fancy a Romantic Comedy, chuck full of slap stick and "chibi" humor, this is a good anime for you. 
Story - The story line was good, not great but good. This is not the first time we have seen a plot of this nature of course, two youngins forced to marry each other due to unforeseen circumstances, however Seto no Hanayome takes a nice approach giving the story line a certain freshness. I did find the storyline to be a bit erratic at some points, but it always seems to come back around to a central point.
Art - I thoroughly enjoyed the artin this anime. It bounces around quite frequently between a standard cartoon anime style, chibi, and even some dashes of a more realistic style without losing the viewers focus. Scenery is basic, but the artist's achieve some pretty good stills throughout the show.


Sound - All i can really say is perfectly suited for this anime. 


Character - A constant barrage of new characters continuously throughout the anime leaves you feeling a bit detached from many of the characters, however there is enough focus and development of the main two characters, Seto San and Nagasumi, to give you a main focal point to ground yourself on throughout the series. There isn't really a point in the show where i didn't have a vested interest in what was going to happen to the characters in the show. 


Overall - While at the beginning i almost felt like the slap stick nature of the anime was being quite overtly shoved down my throat, after the series progressed passed the first few episodes i found myself being unable to tear myself away from watching. It is heart felt, the emotions are believable, and i definitely found myself laughing quite vocally often throughout the series. Overall this anime deserves a soft 8/10.


-Shameless

Don't wait, go right this instant watch Seto No Hanayome if you haven't already, and if you already did, then watch it again. You can't go wrong with Seto No Hanayome, you will enjoy it, even if, like me, you've watched it at least 3 times...

When it comes to comedy there are always many ways you can aproach it, ranging from an spectrum between Really Smart and Downright Stupid, but whatever aproach you may take, if the writing and direction isn't smart and funny then it's all for naught, even if you go with something so insanelly idiotic like a mashup of the Little Mermaid, The Godfather and parodies of beloved action classics.
Thankfully Seto no Hanayome is smart in his implementation and you're left with a series that may drop your IQ to negative levels but pays off with excelent humour that may cheer up even the gloomiest of persons.
OkayI went to far there but I don't lie when I say that Seto no Hanayome is smart about its implementation, it understands well that you cannot go with any level of seriousness when you're telling a story about a boy that ends up engaged with the beloved dauther of a mermaid Yakuza family in the shores of Japan, the same way you cannot hope to sit well in a hallowen costume party wearing a slick suit (unless you're playing G-Man).


What works so well in the series in the main character Nagatsumi, who gets dropped in all kinds of ridiculous situations and his reaction to everything is always spot on, he rejoices at the good times like having a beautifull fiancee, panickes at life threatening situation but becomes so used to them that they become mundane to him, he's an easy to relate character because even though he's a boy living in a ridiculous fantasy word, he's very realisticly written. it also helps that the rest of the cast works very well, they aren't by any means deep compelling characters but they bring a lot of creativity and help up spice up the humour a lot, I don't want to give too much about them because it simply wear of their charm.


As for the other aspects of the animation, I have to say they work well but they aren't exactly "A" Material, the characters look nice although it's all a bit too much "Moe" there are some silly traits to the animation like having rectangular irises and bleeding some sort of rainbow liquid it also doesn't help the fact that they some times go a bit overkill with their expressions and movement, sometimes less is more and you may want to slow down a little otherwise all that movement becomes too much for the eyes.


The score is quite good, The opening really stuck out to my head and I can even remember the lyrics even after not having watched this anime in a long time, the rest of the soundtrack fit very well with the situations and you can expect a wide variety of compossitions that fit very well with the wide array of crazy situations it throws at you, but besides of the opening (and that Enka song it plays when Sakura petals fall down, although for different reasons) the soundtrack isn't very memorable.


In conclussion, what I believe it's the biggest streght of this anime is that it's genuinely funny, it isn't something that's very though provoking, it's as stupid as it gets like laughing at lolcats, but sometimes all stupid entertainment is what we need just to have a very good laugh, and sometimes that's all you need.


Seto no Hanayome really delivers in side spliting humour and you wouldn't, or better yet, couldn't have it any other way

Some people might think that being bad at swimming is normal and not much of a problem. Some people might also think that mermaids are cute lovable creatures, and in some cases they are right. But in poor Nagasumi's case his normal life is twisted as all his believes are turned against him as he is forced to “sleep with the fishes”. Every episode includes a threat to his life and his struggles to keep his engagement a secret from normal people.
This anime has a one of a kind story line that works very well with the romantic comedy theme. I've seen many romantic comediesbut this one is a lot different from all others. The fact that they brought mythical creatures and modern reality together isn't new but is still entertaining and it works.


Each character has their own weird perks and personalities who provide the funny yet life threatening situations which result in comedy gold.


Overall this anime is one of my favourites and I recommend every one and any one whether you're into comedy, romance or both to watch it at least once.


PS: first review 

In Seto no Hanyome, the story must be explained beforehand or else you will not be able to piece the story together. Anyways, lets start the review (you can read the synopsis for yourself), besides the already humorous plot idea of a human marrying a mermaid in a yakuza family, there are also two other mermaids with some delightful backgrounds: Luna, whose family is rich out of their mind and she is a sadistic and egocentric media idol, whose persona is way different from what she seems. And then there is Kai, who is an agoraphobic (fear of wide open spaces) rich boy who enjoystaking long walks on the beach with San in an astronaut suit or in a submarine. XD.


As you can already tell, this story has a lot to offer in the humor department and never fails to deliver that one joke you love to repeat to your friends. The action in here is as well amazing with that funny little comedic twist. Then for the actual characters, each individuals distinct habits create a chaotic comedy, the likes of one that has never been seen before.


Overall 10/10, really this is something that should be watched and enjoyed thoroughly! And a hint of advice, don't watch this on veoh or megavideo (the resolution on the videos suck), I suggest going to animefreak.tv They have the best quality.
